title: Unit Conversions
problem_statement:
Unit Conversions

Problem Description

There are unit_nodes types of unit, and (unit_nodes - 1) relations between them. The relations are defined using three arrays namely unit_from, unit_to and unit_weight where unit_weight[i] magnitude of type unit_to[i] equals 1 magnitude of type unit_from[i].

Given a parameter x, find the magnitude in each unit which will be equivalent to x magnitude in unit 1. For each unit, return the answer modulo (109 + 7).

Note: The relationships between the units form a directed rooted tree, rooted at unit 1, i.e., the in-degree of every node is at most 1 (Unit 1 has in-degree 0).

Consider the following input: unit_nodes = 3, unit_from = [1, 2], unit_to = [2, 3], unit_weight = [2, 1] and x = 1. This represents a chain of conversions where Unit 1 converts to Unit 2 with weight 2, and Unit 2 converts to Unit 3 with weight 1. Specifically, 1 magnitude of unit_from[i] is equivalent to unit_weight[i] magnitudes of unit_to[i].

  • 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 2 magnitudes of unit 2.
  • 1 magnitude of unit 2 is equivalent to 1 magnitude of unit 3.

Given x = 1, so:

  • 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 1 magnitude of unit 1.
  • 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 2 magnitudes of unit 2 (from the first relation).
  • 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 2 magnitudes of unit 3 (from the first and second relations: 1 unit of unit 1 = 2 units of unit 2, and 1 unit of unit 2 = 1 unit of unit 3, so 1 unit of unit 1 = 2 units of unit 3).

So, the answer is [1, 2, 2].

Function Description

Complete the function findEquivalentMagnitude in the editor below.

findEquivalentMagnitude has the following parameters:

  • int unit_nodes: the number of units
  • vector<int> unit_from: the first units in the conversions
  • vector<int> unit_to: the second units in the conversions
  • vector<int> unit_weight: the relation between the first unit and the second unit
  • int x: the magnitude of unit 1

Returns

vector<int>: the values of x magnitude of unit 1 in each unit

Constraints

  • 1 <= unit_nodes <= 105
  • 1 <= unit_from[i], unit_to[i] <= unit_nodes
  • 1 <= unit_weight[i] <= 109

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
3 2
1 2 2
2 3 1
1
Output:
1
2
2

Explanation: The input describes 3 units and 2 relations. Relation 1: unit_from=1, unit_to=2, unit_weight=2, meaning 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 2 magnitudes of unit 2. Relation 2: unit_from=2, unit_to=3, unit_weight=1, meaning 1 magnitude of unit 2 is equivalent to 1 magnitude of unit 3. Given x = 1 unit of unit 1:

  • Magnitude in unit 1: 1 (since 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 1 magnitude of unit 1).
  • Magnitude in unit 2: 2 (since 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 2 magnitudes of unit 2).
  • Magnitude in unit 3: 2 (since 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 2 magnitudes of unit 2, and 1 magnitude of unit 2 is equivalent to 1 magnitude of unit 3, therefore 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 2 magnitudes of unit 3).

The resulting magnitudes are [1, 2, 2].

Example 2:

Input:
2 1
1 2 10
1
Output:
1
10

Explanation: The input describes 2 units and 1 relation. Relation 1: unit_from=1, unit_to=2, unit_weight=10, meaning 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 10 magnitudes of unit 2. Given x = 1 unit of unit 1:

  • Magnitude in unit 1: 1.
  • Magnitude in unit 2: 10 (since 1 magnitude of unit 1 is equivalent to 10 magnitudes of unit 2).

The resulting magnitudes are [1, 10].

title: Cost of MST
problem_statement:
Here's the structured HTML for each problem: ---

Cost of MST

Problem Description

What is the cost of the minimum spanning tree in this graph?

(The problem refers to an accompanying graph image showing nodes and weighted edges.)

---

Prefix vs postfix

Problem Description

Given prefix expression a = x++12345

Given postfix expression b = 12345+x++

Which of the following is true:

---

String Construction

Problem Description

The string S is initially empty. The following can be performed on S any number of times.

  1. Append any character to S for a cost of 5 points.
  2. Copy any substring of S that ends at the current rightmost character. Append it to S for a cost of 5 points.

What is the minimum cost to construct the string "abhibhibhi"?

---

Identify the Sort Algorithm

Problem Description

An array of 8 elements was sorted using some sorting algorithm. The algorithm found the largest number first. After 4 iterations, the array is [2, 4, 5, 7, 8, 1, 3, 6]

Which statement is true?

---

Tail Recursion

Problem Description

Tail recursion

---

Static Code Analysis 8

Problem Description

What will be the output of the following code?

INTEGER n
n = 160
STACK s
while (n > 0)
    s.push(n % 2 == 0)
    n = n/2

while (!s.empty())
    PRINT s.pop()

title: Hashing I
problem_statement:
Hashing I

Problem Description

Given below is a hash function. Which of the following pairs will have the same hash value? Choose all that apply.

hashFunction(string s) {
    int hash = 0;
    for (int i=0; i<s.length; i++) {
        hash += (i+1)*(s[i]-'a'+1);
    }
    return hash;
}

Examples

Example 1:

s = "abeaa"
hash = 1*1 + 2*2 + 3*5 + 4*1 + 5*1 = 29.

Code Cleaning

Problem Description

Which of the following is a valid way to clean the code?

const stringA = "test"
const stringB = "this"
let hashStringA = 0
for (let i = stringA.length; i >= 0; i--) {
    const charCode = stringA.charCodeAt(i)
    hashStringA += 32
    hashStringA += charCode
}

let hashStringB = 0
for (let i = stringB.length; i >= 0; i--) {
    const charCode = stringB.charCodeAt(i)
    hashStringB += 32
    hashStringB += charCode
}

Position of the Pivot Element

Problem Description

Given array = [76, 97, 25, 115, 83, 51, 18, 36]. The array is sorted using the quick sort algorithm with the first element as the pivot element. After applying the partition algorithm, what is the index of the pivot element if indexing starts at 1?

Good Pair

Problem Description

A good pair is two adjacent integers whose sum is even. Which of the following arrangements of arr[N] produce(s) the maximum number of good pairs that is possible?

arr[8] = {10, 9, 13, 15, 3, 16, 9, 13}

Number Converter

Problem Description

Given two integers A and B, convert A to B using the minimum number of operations. The operations allowed are:

  • Subtract 1 from the current value of A.
  • Multiply the current value of A by 2.

For each of these samples, determine the minimum number of operations required. Select the matching list from the answers below.

Examples

Sample 01:

A = 1, B = 2

Sample 02:

A = 9, B = 1

Sample 03:

A = 2, B = 10

Sample 04:

A = 100, B = 500

Complexity Analysis

Problem Description

What is the time complexity of the following code for an input N?

for (int i=1; i<N; i++){
    for (int j=2*i; j<N; j+=i){
        // Some O(1) operation
    }
}

title: Top and Bottom Elements of a Stack
problem_statement:
```html

Top and Bottom Elements of a Stack

Problem Description

In the following postfix expression what are the values of the top and bottom of the stack before the second '*' operation is performed?

632*/321*-+

Valid Pairs

Problem Description

You are given an array arr[], which contains N integers. The task is to count the number of valid pairs present in the array. A valid pair is any two indices i and j where i < j and a[i] - a[j] = -i - j.

Which of the following data structures is best?

Inversion Count

Problem Description

An inversion in a is a distinct pair of indices where i < j and a[i] > a[j].

How many inversions are in a = {5, 7, 9, 2, 3, 12, 8, 4}?

SQL ROUND

Problem Description

The SQL statement

SELECT ROUND(45.926, -2) FROM DUAL;

MySQL: Joins

Problem Description

Which expression is not correct?

SQL Statements

Problem Description

Which of the following statement(s) are NOT correct?

MySQL: CHECK Constraint

Problem Description

Select the statement that is not correct.

```
